verses.textEn: Certainly, O Theophilus, I composed the first discourse about everything that Jesus began to do and to teach,
verses.textLa: Primum quidem sermonem feci de omnibus, O Theophile, quæ cœpit Iesus facere, et docere

verses.textEn: instructing the Apostles, whom he had chosen through the Holy Spirit, even until the day on which he was taken up.
verses.textLa: usque in diem, qua præcipiens Apostolis per Spiritum Sanctum, quos elegit, assumptus est:

verses.textEn: He also presented himself alive to them, after his Passion, appearing to them throughout forty days and speaking about the kingdom of God with many elucidations.
verses.textLa: quibus et præbuit seipsum vivum post Passionem suam in multis argumentis, per dies quadraginta apparens eis, et loquens de regno Dei.

verses.textEn: And dining with them, he instructed them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but that they should wait for the Promise of the Father, “about which you have heard,” he said, “from my own mouth.
verses.textLa: Et convescens, præcepit eis ab Ierosolymis ne discederent, sed expectarent Promissionem Patris, quam audistis (inquit) per os meum:

verses.textEn: For John, indeed, baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit, not many days from now.”
verses.textLa: quia Ioannes quidem baptizavit aqua, vos autem baptizabimini Spiritu Sancto non post multos hos dies.

verses.textEn: Therefore, those who had assembled together questioned him, saying, “Lord, is this the time when you will restore the kingdom of Israel?”
verses.textLa: Igitur qui convenerant, interrogabant eum, dicentes: Domine, si in tempore hoc restitues regnum Israel?

verses.textEn: But he said to them: “It is not yours to know the times or the moments, which the Father has set by his own authority.
verses.textLa: Dixit autem eis: Non est vestrum nosse tempora vel momenta, quæ Pater posuit in sua potestate:

verses.textEn: But you shall receive the power of the Holy Spirit, passing over you, and you shall be witnesses for me in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and even to the ends of the earth.”
verses.textLa: sed accipietis virtutem supervenientis Spiritus Sancti in vos, et eritis mihi testes in Ierusalem, et in omni Iudæa, et Samaria, et usque ad ultimum terræ.

verses.textEn: And when he had said these things, while they were watching, he was lifted up, and a cloud took him from their sight.
verses.textLa: Et cum hæc dixisset, videntibus illis, elevatus est: et nubes suscepit eum ab oculis eorum.

verses.textEn: And while they were watching him going up to heaven, behold, two men stood near them in white vestments.
verses.textLa: Cumque intuerentur in cælum euntem illum, ecce duo viri astiterunt iuxta illos in vestibus albis,

verses.textEn: And they said: “Men of Galilee, why do you stand here looking up toward heaven? This Jesus, who has been taken up from you into heaven, shall return in just the same way that you have seen him going up to heaven.”
verses.textLa: qui et dixerunt: Viri Galilæi, quid statis aspicientes in cælum? Hic Iesus, qui assumptus est a vobis in cælum, sic veniet quemadmodum vidistis eum euntem in cælum.

verses.textEn: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain, which is called Olivet, which is next to Jerusalem, within a Sabbath day’s journey.
verses.textLa: Tunc reversi sunt Ierosolymam a monte, qui vocatur Oliveti, qui est iuxta Ierusalem, Sabbati habens iter.

verses.textEn: And when they had entered into the cenacle, they ascended to the place where Peter and John, James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot, and Jude of James, were staying.
verses.textLa: Et cum introissent in cœnaculum, ascenderunt ubi manebant Petrus, et Ioannes, Iacobus, et Andreas, Philippus, et Thomas, Bartholomæus, et Matthæus, Iacobus Alphæi, et Simon Zelotes, et Iudas Iacobi.

verses.textEn: All these were persevering with one accord in prayer with the women, and with Mary, the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.
verses.textLa: Hi omnes erant perseverantes unanimiter in oratione cum mulieribus, et Maria matre Iesu, et fratribus eius.

verses.textEn: In those days, Peter, rising up in the midst of the brothers, said (now the crowd of men altogether was about one hundred and twenty):
verses.textLa: In diebus illis exurgens Petrus in medio fratrum dixit (erat autem turba hominum simul, fere centum viginti):

verses.textEn: “Noble brothers, the Scripture must be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit predicted by the mouth of David about Judas, who was the leader of those who apprehended Jesus.
verses.textLa: Viri fratres, oportet impleri Scripturam, quam prædixit Spiritus Sanctus per os David de Iuda, qui fuit dux eorum, qui comprehenderunt Iesum:
verses.notes: The word ‘viri’ does not simply mean men; it is derived from a Latin word meaning power or virtue, so it can also mean ‘good men’ or ‘noble men.’ When combined with ‘fratres,’ the meaning is that these brothers are also good or noble.

verses.textEn: He had been numbered among us, and he was chosen by lot for this ministry.
verses.textLa: qui connumeratus erat in nobis, et sortitus est sortem ministerii huius.

verses.textEn: And this man certainly possessed an estate from the wages of iniquity, and so, having been hanged, he burst open in the middle and all his internal organs poured out.
verses.textLa: Et hic quidem possedit agrum de mercede iniquitatis, et suspensus crepuit medius: et diffusa sunt omnia viscera eius.
verses.notes: No one was willing to take down the dead body of someone who had committed suicide, because it was the Feast of Passover, and so his body most probably hung there from Friday, Nisan 14, until at least Saturday, Nisan 22, after sunset. The length of time that he hung there, and the decay of his body, caused his skin to burst open and all his internal organs to pour out.

verses.textEn: And this became known to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that this field was called in their language, Akeldama, that is, ‘Field of Blood.’
verses.textLa: Et notum factum est omnibus habitantibus Ierusalem, ita ut appellaretur ager ille, lingua eorum, Haceldama, hoc est, Ager Sanguinis.

verses.textEn: For it has been written in the book of Psalms: ‘Let their dwelling place be desolate and may there be no one who dwells within it,’ and ‘Let another take his episcopate.’
verses.textLa: Scriptum est enim in libro Psalmorum: Fiat commoratio eorum deserta, et non sit qui inhabitet in ea: et episcopatum eius accipiat alter.

verses.textEn: Therefore, it is necessary that, out of these men who have been assembling with us throughout the entire time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
verses.textLa: Oportet ergo ex his viris, qui nobiscum sunt congregati in omni tempore, quo intravit et exivit inter nos Dominus Iesus,

verses.textEn: beginning from the baptism of John, until the day when he was taken up from us, one of these be made a witness with us of his Resurrection.”
verses.textLa: incipiens a baptismate Ioannis usque in diem, qua assumptus est a nobis, testem Resurrectionis eius nobiscum fieri unum ex istis.

verses.textEn: And they appointed two: Joseph, who was called Barsabbas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
verses.textLa: Et statuerunt duos, Ioseph, qui vocabatur Barsabas, qui cognominatus est Iustus: et Mathiam.
verses.notes: Barsabbas was clearly the more well-known of the two, since he had two nicknames. He was also held, in the opinion of many to be the holier of the two, for he was called Barsabbas (son of the Sabbath) and Justus (the just one). Yet God chose Matthias over Barsabbas, for God knows the hidden secrets of the soul.

verses.textEn: And praying, they said: “May you, O Lord, who knows the heart of everyone, reveal which one of these two you have chosen,
verses.textLa: Et orantes dixerunt: Tu Domine, qui corda nosti omnium, ostende, quem elegeris ex his duobus unum

verses.textEn: to take a place in this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas prevaricated, so that he might go to his own place.”
verses.textLa: accipere locum ministerii huius, et apostolatus, de quo prævaricatus est Iudas ut abiret in locum suum.

verses.textEn: And they cast lots concerning them, and the lot fell upon Matthias. And he was numbered with the eleven Apostles.
verses.textLa: Et dederunt sortes eis, et cecidit sors super Mathiam, et annumeratus est cum undecim Apostolis.

verses.textEn: And when the days of Pentecost were completed, they were all together in the same place.
verses.textLa: Et cum complerentur dies Pentecostes, erant omnes pariter in eodem loco:

verses.textEn: And suddenly, there came a sound from heaven, like that of a wind approaching violently, and it filled the entire house where they were sitting.
verses.textLa: et factus est repente de cælo sonus, tamquam advenientis spiritus vehementis, et replevit totam domum ubi erant sedentes.

verses.textEn: And there appeared to them separate tongues, as if of fire, which settled upon each one of them.
verses.textLa: Et apparuerunt illis dispertitæ linguæ tamquam ignis, seditque supra singulos eorum:

verses.textEn: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit. And they began to speak in various languages, just as the Holy Spirit bestowed eloquence to them.
verses.textLa: et repleti sunt omnes Spiritu Sancto, et cœperunt loqui variis linguis, prout Spiritus Sanctus dabat eloqui illis.

verses.textEn: Now there were Jews staying in Jerusalem, pious men from every nation that is under heaven.
verses.textLa: Erant autem in Ierusalem habitantes Iudæi, viri religiosi ex omni natione, quæ sub cælo est.

verses.textEn: And when this sound occurred, the multitude came together and was confused in mind, because each one was listening to them speaking in his own language.
verses.textLa: Facta autem hac voce, convenit multitudo, et mente confusa est, quoniam audiebat unusquisque lingua sua illos loquentes.

verses.textEn: Then all were astonished, and they wondered, saying: “Behold, are not all of these who are speaking Galileans?
verses.textLa: Stupebant autem omnes, et mirabantur, dicentes: Nonne ecce omnes isti, qui loquuntur, Galilæi sunt,

verses.textEn: And how is it that we have each heard them in our own language, into which we were born?
verses.textLa: et quomodo nos audivimus unusquisque linguam nostram, in qua nati sumus?

verses.textEn: Parthians and Medes and Elamites, and those who inhabit Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
verses.textLa: Parthi, et Medi, et Ælamitæ, et qui habitant Mespotamiam, Iudæam, et Cappadociam, Pontum, et Asiam,

verses.textEn: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya which are around Cyrene, and new arrivals of the Romans,
verses.textLa: Phrygiam, et Pamphyliam, Ægyptum, et partes Libyæ, quæ est circa Cyrenen, et advenæ Romani,

verses.textEn: likewise Jews and new converts, Cretans and Arabs: we have heard them speaking in our own languages the mighty deeds of God.”
verses.textLa: Iudæi quoque, et Proselyti, Cretes, et Arabes: audivimus eos loquentes nostris linguis magnalia Dei.

verses.textEn: And they were all astonished, and they wondered, saying to one another: “But what does this mean?”
verses.textLa: Stupebant autem omnes, et mirabantur ad invicem dicentes: Quidnam vult hoc esse?

verses.textEn: But others mockingly said, “These men are full of new wine.”
verses.textLa: Alii autem irridentes dicebant: Quia musto pleni sunt isti.

verses.textEn: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and he spoke to them: “Men of Judea, and all those who are staying in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and incline your ears to my words.
verses.textLa: Stans autem Petrus cum undecim levavit vocem suam, et locutus est eis: Viri Iudæi, et qui habitatis Ierusalem universi, hoc vobis notum sit, et auribus percipite verba mea.

verses.textEn: For these men are not inebriated, as you suppose, for it is the third hour of the day.
verses.textLa: Non enim, sicut vos æstimatis, hi ebrii sunt, cum sit hora diei tertia:

verses.textEn: But this is what was spoken of by the prophet Joel:
verses.textLa: sed hoc est, quod dictum est per prophetam Ioel:

verses.textEn: ‘And this shall be: in the last days, says the Lord, I will pour out, from my Spirit, upon all flesh. And your sons and your daughters shall prophesy. And your youths shall see visions, and your elders shall dream dreams.
verses.textLa: Et erit in novissimis diebus (dicit Dominus) effundam de Spiritu meo super omnem carnem: et prophetabunt filii vestri, et filiæ vestræ, et iuvenes vestri visiones videbunt, et seniores vestri somnia somniabunt.

verses.textEn: And certainly, upon my men and women servants in those days, I will pour out from my Spirit, and they shall prophesy.
verses.textLa: Et quidem super servos meos, et super ancillas meas in diebus illis effundam de Spiritu meo, et prophetabunt:

verses.textEn: And I will bestow wonders in heaven above, and signs on earth below: blood and fire and the vapor of smoke.
verses.textLa: et dabo prodigia in cælo sursum, et signa in terra deorsum, sanguinem, et ignem, et vaporem fumi:

verses.textEn: The sun shall be turned into darkness and the moon into blood, before the great and manifest day of the Lord arrives.
verses.textLa: Sol convertetur in tenebras, et luna in sanguinem, antequam veniat dies Domini magnus et manifestus.

verses.textEn: And this shall be: whoever shall invoke the name of the Lord will be saved.’
verses.textLa: Et erit: omnis, quicumque invocaverit nomen Domini, salvus erit.

verses.textEn: Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus the Nazarene is a man confirmed by God among you through the miracles and wonders and signs that God accomplished through him in your midst, just as you also know.
verses.textLa: Viri Israelitæ, audite verba hæc: Iesum Nazarenum, virum approbatum a Deo in vobis, virtutibus, et prodigiis, et signis, quæ fecit Deus per illum in medio vestri, sicut et vos scitis:

verses.textEn: This man, under the definitive plan and foreknowledge of God, was delivered by the hands of the unjust, afflicted, and put to death.
verses.textLa: hunc definito consilio, et præscientia Dei traditum, per manus iniquorum affligentes interemistis:

verses.textEn: And he whom God has raised up has broken the sorrows of Hell, for certainly it was impossible for him to be held by it.
verses.textLa: quem Deus suscitavit, solutis doloribus inferni, iuxta quod impossibile erat teneri illum ab eo.

verses.textEn: For David said about him: ‘I foresaw the Lord always in my sight, for he is at my right hand, so that I may not be moved.
verses.textLa: David enim dicit in eum: Providebam Dominum in conspectu meo semper: quoniam a dextris est mihi ne commovear:

verses.textEn: Because of this, my heart has rejoiced, and my tongue has exulted. Moreover, my flesh shall also rest in hope.
verses.textLa: Propter hoc lætatum est cor meum, et exultavit lingua mea, insuper et caro mea requiescet in spe:

verses.textEn: For you will not abandon my soul to Hell, nor will you allow your Holy One to see corruption.
verses.textLa: Quoniam non derelinques animam meam in inferno, nec dabis Sanctum tuum videre corruptionem.

verses.textEn: You have made known to me the ways of life. You will completely fill me with happiness by your presence.’
verses.textLa: Notas mihi fecisti vias vitæ: et replebis me iucunditate cum facie tua.
verses.notes: The word ‘replebis’ is not merely to fill, but to complete or to fill completely. The word ‘iucunditate’ can have the mild meaning of something that is pleasing or agreeable, but in this context of complete fulfillment in the presence of God, it can only mean happiness.

verses.textEn: Noble brothers, permit me to speak freely to you about the Patriarch David: for he passed away and was buried, and his sepulcher is with us, even to this very day.
verses.textLa: Viri fratres, liceat audenter dicere ad vos de patriarcha David quoniam defunctus est, et sepultus: et sepulchrum eius est apud nos usque in hodiernum diem.

verses.textEn: Therefore, he was a prophet, for he knew that God had sworn an oath to him about the fruit of his loins, about the One who would sit upon his throne.
verses.textLa: Propheta igitur cum esset, et sciret quia iureiurando iurasset illi Deus de fructu lumbi eius sedere super sedem eius:

verses.textEn: Foreseeing this, he was speaking about the Resurrection of the Christ. For he was neither left behind in Hell, nor did his flesh see corruption.
verses.textLa: providens locutus est de Resurrectione Christi, quia neque derelictus est in inferno, neque caro eius vidit corruptionem.

verses.textEn: This Jesus, God raised up again, and of this we are all witnesses.
verses.textLa: Hunc Iesum resuscitavit Deus, cuius omnes nos testes sumus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, being exalted to the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the Promise of the Holy Spirit, he poured this out, just as you now see and hear.
verses.textLa: Dextera igitur Dei exaltatus, et promissione Spiritus Sancti accepta a Patre, effudit hunc, quem vos videtis, et auditis.

verses.textEn: For David did not ascend into heaven. But he himself said: ‘The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand,
verses.textLa: Non enim David ascendit in cælum: dixit autem ipse: Dixit Dominus Domino meo, sede a dextris meis

verses.textEn: until I make your enemies your footstool.’
verses.textLa: donec ponam inimicos tuos scabellum pedum tuorum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, may the entire house of Israel know most certainly that God has made this same Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Christ.”
verses.textLa: Certissime sciat ergo omnis domus Israel, quia et Dominum eum, et Christum fecit Deus, hunc Iesum, quem vos crucifixistis.

verses.textEn: Now when they had heard these things, they were contrite in heart, and they said to Peter and to the other Apostles: “What should we do, noble brothers?”
verses.textLa: His autem auditis, compuncti sunt corde, et dixerunt ad Petrum, et ad reliquos Apostolos: Quid faciemus, viri fratres?

verses.textEn: Yet truly, Peter said to them: “Do penance; and be baptized, each one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ, for the remission of your sins. And you shall receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.textLa: Petrus vero ad illos: Pœnitentiam (inquit) agite, et baptizetur unusquisque vestrum in nomine Iesu Christi in remissionem peccatorum vestrorum: et accipietis donum Spiritus Sancti.

verses.textEn: For the Promise is for you and for your sons, and for all who are far away: for whomever the Lord our God will have called.”
verses.textLa: Vobis enim est repromissio, et filiis vestris, et omnibus, qui longe sunt, quoscumque advocaverit Dominus Deus noster.

verses.textEn: And then, with very many other words, he testified and he exhorted them, saying, “Save yourselves from this depraved generation.”
verses.textLa: Aliis etiam verbis plurimis testificatus est, et exhortabatur eos, dicens: Salvamini a generatione ista prava.

verses.textEn: Therefore, those who accepted his discourse were baptized. And about three thousand souls were added on that day.
verses.textLa: Qui ergo receperunt sermonem eius, baptizati sunt: et appositæ sunt in die illa animæ circiter tria millia.

verses.textEn: Now they were persevering in the doctrine of the Apostles, and in the communion of the breaking of the bread, and in the prayers.
verses.textLa: Erant autem perseverantes in doctrina Apostolorum, et communicatione fractionis panis, et orationibus.

verses.textEn: And fear developed in every soul. Also, many miracles and signs were accomplished by the Apostles in Jerusalem. And there was a great awe in everyone.
verses.textLa: Fiebat autem omni animæ timor: multa quoque prodigia, et signa per Apostolos in Ierusalem fiebant, et metus erat magnus in universis.

verses.textEn: And then all who believed were together, and they held all things in common.
verses.textLa: Omnes etiam, qui credebant, erant pariter, et habebant omnia communia.

verses.textEn: They were selling their possessions and belongings, and dividing them to all, just as any of them had need.
verses.textLa: Possessiones et substantias vendebant, et dividebant illa omnibus, prout cuique opus erat.

verses.textEn: Also, they continued, daily, to be of one accord in the temple and to break bread among the houses; and they took their meals with exultation and simplicity of heart,
verses.textLa: Quotidie quoque perdurantes unanimiter in templo, et frangentes circa domos panem, sumebant cibum cum exultatione, et simplicitate cordis,

verses.textEn: praising God greatly, and holding favor with all the people. And every day, the Lord increased those who were being saved among them.
verses.textLa: collaudantes Deum, et habentes gratiam ad omnem plebem. Dominus autem augebat qui salvi fierent quotidie in idipsum.

verses.textEn: Now Peter and John went up to the temple at the ninth hour of prayer.
verses.textLa: Petrus autem, et Ioannes ascendebant in templum ad horam orationis nonam.

verses.textEn: And a certain man, who was lame from his mother’s womb, was being carried in. They would lay him every day at the gate of the temple, which is called the Beautiful, so that he might request alms from those entering into the temple.
verses.textLa: Et quidam vir, qui erat claudus ex utero matris suæ, baiulabatur: quem ponebant quotidie ad portam templi, quæ dicitur Speciosa, ut peteret eleemosynam ab introeuntibus in templum.

verses.textEn: And this man, when he had seen Peter and John beginning to enter the temple, was begging, so that he might receive alms.
verses.textLa: Is cum vidisset Petrum, et Ioannem incipientes introire in templum, rogabat ut eleemosynam acciperet.

verses.textEn: Then Peter and John, gazing at him, said, “Look at us.”
verses.textLa: Intuens autem in eum Petrus cum Ioanne, dixit: Respice in nos.

verses.textEn: And he looked intently at them, hoping that he might receive something from them.
verses.textLa: At ille intendebat in eos, sperans se aliquid accepturum ab eis.

verses.textEn: But Peter said: “Silver and gold is not mine. But what I have, I give to you. In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, rise up and walk.”
verses.textLa: Petrus autem dixit: Argentum et aurum non est mihi: quod autem habeo, hoc tibi do: In nomine Iesu Christi Nazareni surge, et ambula.

verses.textEn: And taking him by the right hand, he lifted him up. And immediately his legs and feet were strengthened.
verses.textLa: Et apprehensa manu eius dextera, allevavit eum, et protinus consolidatæ sunt bases eius, et plantæ.

verses.textEn: And leaping up, he stood and walked around. And he entered with them into the temple, walking and leaping and praising God.
verses.textLa: Et exiliens stetit, et ambulabat: et intravit cum illis in templum ambulans, et exiliens, et laudans Deum.

verses.textEn: And all the people saw him walking and praising God.
verses.textLa: Et vidit omnis populus eum ambulantem, et laudantem Deum.

verses.textEn: And they recognized him, that he was the same one who was sitting for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. And they were filled with awe and amazement at what had happened to him.
verses.textLa: Cognoscebant autem illum, quod ipse erat, qui ad eleemosynam sedebat ad Speciosam portam templi: et impleti sunt stupore et extasi in eo, quod contingerat illi.

verses.textEn: Then, as he held on to Peter and John, all the people ran to them at the portico, which is called Solomon’s, in astonishment.
verses.textLa: Cum teneret autem Petrum, et Ioannem, cucurrit omnis populus ad eos ad porticum, quæ appellatur Salomonis, stupentes.

verses.textEn: But Peter, seeing this, responded to the people: “Men of Israel, why do you wonder at this? Or why do you stare at us, as if it were by our own strength or power that we caused this man to walk?
verses.textLa: Videns autem Petrus, respondit ad populum: Viri Israelitæ quid miramini in hoc, aut nos quid intuemini, quasi nostra virtute aut potestate fecerimus hunc ambulare?

verses.textEn: The God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Son Jesus, whom you, indeed, handed over and denied before the face of Pilate, when he was giving judgment to release him.
verses.textLa: Deus Abraham, et Deus Isaac, et Deus Iacob, Deus patrum nostrorum glorificavit Filium suum Iesum, quem vos quidem tradidistis, et negastis ante faciem Pilati, iudicante illo dimitti.

verses.textEn: Then you denied the Holy and Just One, and petitioned for a murderous man to be given to you.
verses.textLa: Vos autem Sanctum, et Iustum negastis, et petistis virum homicidam donari vobis:

verses.textEn: Truly, it was the Author of Life whom you put to death, whom God raised from the dead, to whom we are witnesses.
verses.textLa: Auctorem vero vitæ interfecistis, quem Deus suscitavit a mortuis, cuius nos testes sumus.

verses.textEn: And by faith in his name, this man, whom you have seen and known, has confirmed his name. And faith through him has given this man complete health in the sight of you all.
verses.textLa: Et in fide nominis eius, hunc, quem vos vidistis, et nostis, confirmavit nomen eius: et fides, quæ per eum est, dedit integram sanitatem istam in conspectu omnium vestrum.

verses.textEn: And now, brothers, I know that you did this through ignorance, just as your leaders also did.
verses.textLa: Et nunc fratres scio quia per ignorantiam fecistis, sicut et principes vestri.

verses.textEn: But in this way God has fulfilled the things that he announced beforehand through the mouth of all the Prophets: that his Christ would suffer.
verses.textLa: Deus autem, quæ prænunciavit per os omnium Prophetarum, pati Christum suum, sic implevit.

verses.textEn: Therefore, repent and be converted, so that your sins may be wiped away.
verses.textLa: Pœnitemini igitur, et convertimini ut deleantur peccata vestra:

verses.textEn: And then, when the time of consolation will have arrived from the presence of the Lord, he will send the One who was foretold to you, Jesus Christ,
verses.textLa: ut cum venerint tempora refrigerii a conspectu Domini, et miserit eum, qui prædicatus est vobis, Iesum Christum,
verses.notes: The time of consolation is the time of the Return of Jesus Christ, after the end of the Antichrist’s reign.

verses.textEn: whom heaven certainly must take up, until the time of the restoration of all things, which God has spoken of by the mouth of his holy prophets, from ages past.
verses.textLa: quem oportet quidem cælum suscipere usque in tempora restitutionis omnium, quæ locutus est Deus per os sanctorum suorum a sæculo Prophetarum.
verses.notes: But then, after Christ’s return, Heaven must certainly take him up again (Second Ascension), until yet another time, the time of the restoration of all things, Judgment Day, after which God makes a new heaven and a new earth. This passage supports the teaching that Christ returns twice: once at the end of the Antichrist’s reign, to establish his kingdom on earth, and again, well over a thousand years later, at the end of the Millennium of peace and holiness, for Judgment and the restoration of all things.

verses.textEn: Indeed, Moses said: ‘For the Lord your God shall raise up a Prophet for you from your brothers, one like me; the same shall you listen to according to everything whatsoever that he shall speak to you.
verses.textLa: Moyses quidem dixit: Quoniam Prophetam suscitabit vobis Dominus Deus vester de fratribus vestris, tamquam me, ipsum audietis iuxta omnia quæcumque locutus fuerit vobis.

verses.textEn: And this shall be: every soul who will not listen to that Prophet shall be exterminated from the people.’
verses.textLa: Erit autem: omnis anima, quæ non audierit Prophetam illum, exterminabitur de plebe.

verses.textEn: And all the prophets who have spoken, from Samuel and thereafter, have announced these days.
verses.textLa: Et omnes prophetæ a Samuel, et deinceps, qui locuti sunt, annunciaverunt dies istos.

verses.textEn: You are sons of the prophets and of the testament which God has appointed for our fathers, saying to Abraham: ‘And by your offspring all the families of the earth shall be blessed.’
verses.textLa: Vos estis filii prophetarum et testamenti, quod disposuit Deus ad patres nostros, dicens ad Abraham: Et in semine tuo benedicentur omnes familiæ terræ.

verses.textEn: God raised up his Son and sent him first to you, to bless you, so that each one may turn himself away from his wickedness.”
verses.textLa: Vobis primum Deus suscitans Filium suum, misit eum benedicentem vobis: ut convertat se unusquisque a nequitia sua.

verses.textEn: But while they were speaking to the people, the priests and the magistrate of the temple and the Sadducees overwhelmed them,
verses.textLa: Loquentibus autem illis ad populum, supervenerunt sacerdotes, et magistratus templi, et Sadducæi,

verses.textEn: being grieved that they were teaching the people and announcing in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
verses.textLa: dolentes quod docerent populum, et annunciarent in Iesu resurrectionem ex mortuis:

verses.textEn: And they laid hands on them, and they placed them under guard until the next day. For it was now evening.
verses.textLa: et iniecerunt in eos manus, et posuerunt eos in custodiam in crastinum: erat enim iam vespera.

verses.textEn: But many of those who had heard the word believed. And the number of men became five thousand.
verses.textLa: Multi autem eorum, qui audierant verbum, crediderunt: et factus est numerus virorum quinque millia.

verses.textEn: And it happened on the next day that their leaders and elders and scribes gathered together in Jerusalem,
verses.textLa: Factum est autem in crastinum, ut congregarentur principes eorum, et seniores, et scribæ in Ierusalem,

verses.textEn: including Annas, the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John and Alexander, and as many as were of the priestly family.
verses.textLa: et Annas princeps sacerdotum, et Caiphas, et Ioannes, et Alexander, et quotquot erant de genere sacerdotali.

verses.textEn: And stationing them in the middle, they questioned them: “By what power, or in whose name, have you done this?”
verses.textLa: Et statuentes eos in medio, interrogabant: In qua virtute, aut in quo nomine fecistis hoc vos?

verses.textEn: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them: “Leaders of the people and elders, listen.
verses.textLa: Tunc repletus Spiritu Sancto Petrus, dixit ad eos: Principes populi, et seniores audite:

verses.textEn: If we today are judged by a good deed done to an infirm man, by which he has been made whole,
verses.textLa: Si nos hodie diiudicamur in benefacto hominis infirmi, in quo iste salvus factus est,

verses.textEn: let it be known to all of you and to all of the people of Israel, that in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ the Nazarene, whom you crucified, whom God has raised from the dead, by him, this man stands before you, healthy.
verses.textLa: notum sit omnibus vobis, et omni plebi Israel: quia in nomine Domini nostri Iesu Christi Nazareni, quem vos crucifixistis, quem Deus suscitavit a mortuis, in hoc iste astat coram vobis sanus.

verses.textEn: He is the stone, which was rejected by you, the builders, which has become the head of the corner.
verses.textLa: Hic est lapis, qui reprobatus est a vobis ædificantibus, qui factus est in caput anguli:

verses.textEn: And there is no salvation in any other. For there is no other name under heaven given to men, by which it is necessary for us to be saved.”
verses.textLa: et non est in alio aliquo salus. Nec enim aliud nomen est sub cælo datum hominibus, in quo oporteat nos salvos fieri.

verses.textEn: Then, seeing the constancy of Peter and John, having verified that they were men without letters or learning, they wondered. And they recognized that they had been with Jesus.
verses.textLa: Videntes autem Petri constantiam, et Ioannis, comperto quod homines essent sine litteris, et idiotæ, admirabantur, et cognoscebant eos quoniam cum Iesu fuerant:

verses.textEn: Also, seeing the man who had been cured standing with them, they were unable to say anything to contradict them.
verses.textLa: hominem quoque videntes stantem cum eis, qui curatus fuerat, nihil poterant contradicere.

verses.textEn: But they ordered them to withdraw outside, away from the council, and they conferred among themselves,
verses.textLa: Iusserunt autem eos foras extra concilium secedere: et conferebant ad invicem,

verses.textEn: saying: “What shall we do to these men? For certainly a public sign has been done through them, before all the inhabitants of Jerusalem. It is manifest, and we cannot deny it.
verses.textLa: dicentes: Quid faciemus hominibus istis? quoniam quidem notum signum factum est per eos, omnibus habitantibus Ierusalem: manifestum est, et non possumus negare.

verses.textEn: But lest it spread further among the people, let us threaten them not to speak anymore in this name to any man.”
verses.textLa: Sed ne amplius divulgetur in populum, comminemur eis, ne ultra loquantur in nomine hoc ulli hominum.

verses.textEn: And calling them in, they warned them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
verses.textLa: Et vocantes eos, denunciaverunt ne omnino loquerentur, neque docerent in nomine Iesu.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, Peter and John said in response to them: “Judge whether it is just in the sight of God to listen to you, rather than to God.
verses.textLa: Petrus vero, et Ioannes respondentes, dixerunt ad eos: Si iustum est in conspectu Dei, vos potius audire quam Deum, iudicate.

verses.textEn: For we are unable to refrain from speaking the things that we have seen and heard.”
verses.textLa: Non enim possumus quæ vidimus et audivimus non loqui.
verses.notes: This double negative in the Latin translates awkwardly if it is translated too literally.

verses.textEn: But they, threatening them, sent them away, having not found a way that they might punish them because of the people. For all were glorifying the things that had been done in these events.
verses.textLa: At illi comminantes dimiserunt eos: non invenientes quomodo punirent eos propter populum, quia omnes clarificabant id, quod factum fuerat in eo quod acciderat.

verses.textEn: For the man in whom this sign of a cure had been accomplished was more than forty years old.
verses.textLa: Annorum enim erat amplius quadraginta homo, in quo factum fuerat signum istud sanitatis.

verses.textEn: Then, having been released, they went to their own, and they reported in full what the leaders of the priests and the elders had said to them.
verses.textLa: Dimissi autem venerunt ad suos: et annunciaverunt eis quanta ad eos principes sacerdotum, et seniores dixissent.

verses.textEn: And when they had heard it, with one accord, they lifted up their voice to God, and they said: “Lord, you are the One who made heaven and earth, the sea and all that is in them,
verses.textLa: Qui cum audissent, unanimiter levaverunt vocem ad Deum, et dixerunt: Domine, tu es qui fecisti cælum, et terram, mare, et omnia, quæ in eis sunt:

verses.textEn: who, by the Holy Spirit, through the mouth of our father David, your servant, said: ‘Why have the Gentiles been seething, and why have the people been pondering nonsense?
verses.textLa: qui Spiritu Sancto per os patris nostri David, pueri tui, dixisti: Quare fremuerunt Gentes, et populi meditati sunt inania?

verses.textEn: The kings of the earth have stood up, and the leaders have joined together as one, against the Lord and against his Christ.’
verses.textLa: Astiterunt reges terræ, et principes convenerunt in unum adversus Dominum, et adversus Christum eius.

verses.textEn: For truly Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, joined together in this city against your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed
verses.textLa: Convenerunt enim vere in civitate ista adversus sanctum puerum tuum Iesum, quem unxisti, Herodes, et Pontius Pilatus, cum Gentibus, et populis Israel,

verses.textEn: to do what your hand and your counsel had decreed would be done.
verses.textLa: facere quæ manus tua, et consilium tuum decreverunt fieri.

verses.textEn: And now, O Lord, look upon their threats, and grant to your servants that they may speak your word with all confidence,
verses.textLa: Et nunc Domine respice in minas eorum, et da servis tuis cum omni fiducia loqui verbum tuum,

verses.textEn: by extending your hand in cures and signs and miracles, to be done through the name of your holy Son, Jesus.”
verses.textLa: in eo quod manum tuam extendas ad sanitates, et signa, et prodigia fieri per nomen sancti Filii tui Iesu.

verses.textEn: And when they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered was moved. And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit. And they were speaking the Word of God with confidence.
verses.textLa: Et cum orassent, motus est locus, in quo erant congregati: et repleti sunt omnes Spiritu Sancto, et loquebantur verbum Dei cum fiducia.

verses.textEn: Then the multitude of believers were of one heart and one soul. Neither did anyone say that any of the things that he possessed were his own, but all things were common to them.
verses.textLa: Multitudinis autem credentium erat cor unum, et anima una: nec quisquam eorum, quæ possidebat, aliquid suum esse dicebat, sed erant illis omnia communia.

verses.textEn: And with great power, the Apostles were rendering testimony to the Resurrection of Jesus Christ our Lord. And great grace was in them all.
verses.textLa: Et virtute magna reddebant Apostoli testimonium Resurrectionis Iesu Christi Domini nostri: et gratia magna erat in omnibus illis.

verses.textEn: And neither was anyone among them in need. For as many as were owners of fields or houses, selling these, were bringing the proceeds of the things that they were selling,
verses.textLa: Neque enim quisquam egens erat inter illos. Quotquot enim possessores agrorum, aut domorum erant vendentes afferebant pretia eorum, quæ vendebant,

verses.textEn: and were placing it before the feet of the Apostles. Then it was divided to each one, just as he had need.
verses.textLa: et ponebant ante pedes Apostolorum. Dividebatur autem singulis prout cuique opus erat.

verses.textEn: Now Joseph, who the Apostles surnamed Barnabas (which is translated as ‘son of consolation’), who was a Levite of Cyprian descent,
verses.textLa: Ioseph autem, qui cognominatus est Barnabas ab Apostolis, (quod est interpretatum filius consolationis) Levites, Cyprius genere,

verses.textEn: since he had land, he sold it, and he brought the proceeds and placed these at the feet of the Apostles.
verses.textLa: cum haberet agrum, vendidit eum, et attulit pretium, et posuit ante pedes Apostolorum.

verses.textEn: But a certain man named Ananias, with his wife Sapphira, sold a field,
verses.textLa: Vir autem quidam nomine Ananias, cum Saphira uxore suo vendidit agrum,

verses.textEn: and he was deceitful about the price of the field, with his wife’s consent. And bringing only part of it, he placed it at the feet of the Apostles.
verses.textLa: et fraudavit de pretio agri, conscia uxore sua: et afferens partem quamdam, ad pedes Apostolorum posuit.

verses.textEn: But Peter said: “Ananias, why has Satan tempted your heart, so that you would lie to the Holy Spirit and be deceitful about the price of the land?
verses.textLa: Dixit autem Petrus: Anania, cur tentavit Satanas cor tuum, mentiri te Spiritui Sancto, et fraudare de pretio agri?

verses.textEn: Did it not belong to you while you retained it? And having sold it, was it not in your power? Why have you set this thing in your heart? You have not lied to men, but to God!”
verses.textLa: Nonne manens tibi manebat, et venundatum in tua erat potestate? Quare posuisti in corde tuo hanc rem? Non es mentitus hominibus, sed Deo.

verses.textEn: Then Ananias, upon hearing these words, fell down and expired. And a great fear overwhelmed all who heard of it.
verses.textLa: Audiens autem Ananias hæc verba, cecidit, et expiravit. Et factus est timor magnus super omnes, qui audierunt.

verses.textEn: And the young men rose up and removed him; and carrying him out, they buried him.
verses.textLa: Surgentes autem iuvenes amoverunt eum, et efferentes sepelierunt.

verses.textEn: Then about the space of three hours passed, and his wife entered, not knowing what had happened.
verses.textLa: Factum est autem quasi horarum trium spatium, et uxor ipsius, nesciens quod factum fuerat, introivit.

verses.textEn: And Peter said to her, “Tell me, woman, if you sold the field for this amount?” And she said, “Yes, for that amount.”
verses.textLa: Dixit autem ei Petrus: Dic mihi mulier, si tanti agrum vendidistis? At illa dixit: Etiam tanti.

verses.textEn: And Peter said to her: “Why have you agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they shall carry you out!”
verses.textLa: Petrus autem ad eam: Quid utique convenit vobis tentare Spiritum Domini? Ecce pedes eorum, qui sepelierunt virum tuum ad ostium, et efferent te.

verses.textEn: Immediately, she fell down before his feet and expired. Then the young men entered and found her dead. And they carried her out and buried her next to her husband.
verses.textLa: Confestim cecidit ante pedes eius, et expiravit. Intrantes autem iuvenes invenerunt illam mortuam: et extulerunt, et sepelierunt ad virum suum.

verses.textEn: And a great fear came over the entire Church and over all who heard these things.
verses.textLa: Et factus est timor magnus in universa Ecclesia, et in omnes, qui audierunt hæc.

verses.textEn: And through the hands of the Apostles many signs and wonders were accomplished among the people. And they all met with one accord at Solomon’s portico.
verses.textLa: Per manus autem Apostolorum fiebant signa, et prodigia multa in plebe. Et erant unanimiter omnes in porticu Salomonis.

verses.textEn: And among the others, no one dared to join himself to them. But the people magnified them.
verses.textLa: Ceterorum autem nemo audebat se coniungere illis: sed magnificabat eos populus.

verses.textEn: Now the multitude of men and women who believed in the Lord was ever increasing,
verses.textLa: Magis autem augebatur credentium in Domino multitudo virorum, ac mulierum,

verses.textEn: so much so that they laid the infirm in the streets, placing them on beds and stretchers, so that, as Peter arrived, at least his shadow might fall upon any one of them, and they would be freed from their infirmities.
verses.textLa: ita ut in plateas eiicerent infirmos, et ponerent in lectulis et grabatis, ut, veniente Petro, saltem umbra illius obumbraret quemquam illorum, et liberarentur ab infirmitatibus suis.

verses.textEn: But a multitude also hurried to Jerusalem from the neighboring cities, carrying the sick and those troubled by unclean spirits, who were all healed.
verses.textLa: Concurrebat autem et multitudo vicinarum civitatum Ierusalem, afferentes ægros, et vexatos a spiritibus immundis: qui curabantur omnes.

verses.textEn: Then the high priest and all those who were with him, that is, the heretical sect of the Sadducees, rose up and were filled with jealousy.
verses.textLa: Exurgens autem princeps sacerdotum, et omnes, qui cum illo erant, (quæ est hæresis Sadducæorum) repleti sunt zelo:
verses.notes: Notice that the Pharisees have now lost power, and the Sadducees are the ones who are associated with the high priest and are influential with him. The Sadducees were heretical because they did not believe in Angels, nor in fallen angels, nor in the Resurrection. The Pharisees probably lost power due to their actions against Jesus, whereby they pressured Pilate to allow him to be put to death, even though he was innocent.

verses.textEn: And they laid hands on the Apostles, and they placed them in the common prison.
verses.textLa: et iniecerunt manus in Apostolos, et posuerunt eos in custodia publica.

verses.textEn: But in the night, an Angel of the Lord opened the doors of the prison and led them out, saying,
verses.textLa: Angelus autem Domini per noctem aperiens ianuas carceris, et educens eos, dixit:

verses.textEn: “Go and stand in the temple, speaking to the people all these words of life.”
verses.textLa: Ite, et stantes loquimini in templo plebi omnia verba vitæ huius.

verses.textEn: And when they had heard this, they entered the temple at first light, and they were teaching. Then the high priest, and those who were with him, approached, and they called together the council and all the elders of the sons of Israel. And they sent to the prison to have them brought.
verses.textLa: Qui cum audissent, intraverunt diluculo in templum, et docebant. Adveniens autem princeps sacerdotum, et qui cum eo erant, convocaverunt concilium, et omnes seniores filiorum Israel: et miserunt ad carcerem ut adducerentur.

verses.textEn: But when the attendants had arrived, and, upon opening the prison, had not found them, they returned and reported to them,
verses.textLa: Cum autem venissent ministri, et aperto carcere non invenissent illos, reversi nunciaverunt,

verses.textEn: saying: “We found the prison certainly locked up with all diligence, and the guards standing before the door. But upon opening it, we found no one within.”
verses.textLa: dicentes: Carcerem quidem invenimus clausum cum omni diligentia, et custodes stantes ante ianuas: aperientes autem neminem intus invenimus.

verses.textEn: Then, when the magistrate of the temple and the chief priests heard these words, they were uncertain about them, as to what should happen.
verses.textLa: Ut autem audierunt hos sermones magistratus templi, et principes sacerdotum ambigebant de illis quidnam fieret.

verses.textEn: But someone arrived and reported to them, “Behold, the men whom you placed in prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people.”
verses.textLa: Adveniens autem quidam nunciavit eis: Quia ecce viri, quos posuistis in carcerem, sunt in templo stantes, et docentes populum.

verses.textEn: Then the magistrate, with the attendants, went and brought them without force. For they were afraid of the people, lest they be stoned.
verses.textLa: Tunc abiit magistratus cum ministris, et adduxit illos sine vi: timebant enim populum ne lapidarentur.

verses.textEn: And when they had brought them, they stood them before the council. And the high priest questioned them,
verses.textLa: Et cum adduxissent illos, statuerunt in concilio: Et interrogavit eos princeps sacerdotum,

verses.textEn: and said: “We strongly order you not to teach in this name. For behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and you wish to bring the blood of this man upon us.”
verses.textLa: dicens: Præcipiendo præcepimus vobis ne doceretis in nomine isto: et ecce replestis Ierusalem doctrina vestra: et vultis inducere super nos sanguinem hominis istius.
verses.notes: The repetition of the verb intensifies its meaning.

verses.textEn: But Peter and the Apostles responded by saying: “It is necessary to obey God, more so than men.
verses.textLa: Respondens autem Petrus, et Apostoli, dixerunt: Obedire oportet Deo magis, quam hominibus.

verses.textEn: The God of our fathers has raised up Jesus, whom you put to death by hanging him on a tree.
verses.textLa: Deus patrum nostrorum suscitavit Iesum, quem vos interemistis, suspendentes in ligno.

verses.textEn: It is he whom God has exalted at his right hand as Ruler and Savior, so as to offer repentance and the remission of sins to Israel.
verses.textLa: Hunc Principem, et Salvatorem Deus exaltavit dextera sua ad dandam pœnitentiam Israeli, et remissionem peccatorum.

verses.textEn: And we are witnesses of these things, with the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to all who are obedient to him.”
verses.textLa: Et nos sumus testes horum verborum, et Spiritus Sanctus, quem dedit Deus omnibus obedientibus sibi.
verses.notes: The Holy Spirit and sanctifying grace are not given only to those who are formally baptized, but those who are obedient to the will of God can also receive sanctifying grace in a non-formal baptism.

verses.textEn: When they had heard these things, they were deeply wounded, and they were planning to put them to death.
verses.textLa: Hæc cum audissent, dissecabantur, et cogitabant interficere illos.

verses.textEn: But someone in the council, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law honored by all the people, rose up and ordered the men to be put outside briefly.
verses.textLa: Surgens autem quidam in concilio Pharisæus, nomine Gamaliel, legisdoctor honorabilis universæ plebi, iussit foras ad breve homines fieri.

verses.textEn: And he said to them: “Men of Israel, you should be careful in your intentions about these men.
verses.textLa: Dixitque ad illos: Viri Israelitæ attendite vobis super hominibus istis quid acturi sitis.

verses.textEn: For before these days, Theudas stepped forward, asserting himself to be someone, and a number of men, about four hundred, joined with him. But he was killed, and all who believed in him were scattered, and they were reduced to nothing.
verses.textLa: Ante hos enim dies extitit Theodas, dicens se esse aliquem, cui consensit numerus virorum circiter quadringentorum: qui occisus est: et omnes, qui credebant ei, dissipati sunt, et redacti ad nihilum.

verses.textEn: After this one, Judas the Galilean stepped forward, in the days of the enrollment, and he turned the people toward himself. But he also perished, and all of them, as many as had joined with him, were dispersed.
verses.textLa: Post hunc extitit Iudas Galilæus in diebus professionis, et avertit populum post se, et ipse periit: et omnes, quotquot consenserunt ei, dispersi sunt.

verses.textEn: And now therefore, I say to you, withdraw from these men and leave them alone. For if this counsel or work is of men, it will be broken.
verses.textLa: Et nunc itaque dico vobis, discedite ab hominibus istis, et sinite illos: quoniam si est ex hominibus consilium hoc, aut opus, dissolvetur:

verses.textEn: Yet truly, if it is of God, you will not be able to break it, and perhaps you might be found to have fought against God.” And they agreed with him.
verses.textLa: si vero ex Deo est, non poteritis dissolvere illud, ne forte et Deo repugnare inveniamini. Consenserunt autem illi.

verses.textEn: And calling in the Apostles, having beaten them, they warned them not to speak at all in the name of Jesus. And they dismissed them.
verses.textLa: Et convocantes Apostolos, cæsis denunciaverunt ne omnino loquerentur in nomine Iesu, et dimiserunt eos.

verses.textEn: And indeed, they went forth from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were considered worthy to suffer insult on behalf of the name of Jesus.
verses.textLa: Et illi quidem ibant gaudentes a conspectu concilii, quoniam digni habiti sunt pro nomine Iesu contumeliam pati.

verses.textEn: And every day, in the temple and among the houses, they did not cease to teach and to evangelize Christ Jesus.
verses.textLa: Omni autem die non cessabant in templo, et circa domos docentes, et evangelizantes Christum Iesum.

verses.textEn: In those days, as the number of disciples was increasing, there occurred a murmuring of the Greeks against the Hebrews, because their widows were treated with disdain in the daily ministration.
verses.textLa: In diebus illis, crescente numero discipulorum, factum est murmur Græcorum adversus Hebræos, eo quod despicerentur in ministerio quotidiano viduæ eorum.

verses.textEn: And so the twelve, calling together the multitude of the disciples, said: “It is not fair for us to leave behind the Word of God to serve at tables also.
verses.textLa: Convocantes autem duodecim multitudinem discipulorum dixerunt: Non est æquum nos derelinquere verbum Dei, et ministrare mensis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, brothers, search among yourselves for seven men of good testimony, filled with the Holy Spirit and with wisdom, whom we may appoint over this work.
verses.textLa: Considerate ergo fratres, viros ex vobis boni testimonii septem, plenos Spiritu Sancto, et sapientia, quos constituamus super hoc opus.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, we will be continually in prayer and in the ministry of the Word.”
verses.textLa: Nos vero orationi, et ministerio verbi instantes erimus.

verses.textEn: And the plan pleased the entire multitude. And they chose Stephen, a man filled with faith and with the Holy Spirit, and Philip and Prochorus and Nicanor and Timon and Parmenas and Nicolas, a new arrival from Antioch.
verses.textLa: Et placuit sermo coram omni multitudine. Et elegerunt Stephanum, virum plenum fide, et Spiritu Sancto, et Philippum, et Prochorum, et Nicanorem, et Timonem, et Parmenam, et Nicolaum advenam Antiochenum.
verses.notes: It is this Nicolas whom the Nicolaitans claim was the inspiration for their heretical group, but he himself was never a member, nor the founder, of the group, nor did he teach their heresies.

verses.textEn: These they set before the sight of the Apostles, and while praying, they imposed hands on them.
verses.textLa: Hos statuerunt ante conspectum Apostolorum: et orantes imposuerunt eis manus.

verses.textEn: And the Word of the Lord was increasing, and the number of disciples in Jerusalem was multiplied exceedingly. And even a large group of the priests were obedient to the faith.
verses.textLa: Et verbum Domini crescebat, et multiplicabatur numerus discipulorum in Ierusalem valde: multa etiam turba sacerdotum obediebat fidei.

verses.textEn: Then Stephen, filled with grace and fortitude, wrought great signs and miracles among the people.
verses.textLa: Stephanus autem plenus gratia, et fortitudine faciebat prodigia, et signa magna in populo.

verses.textEn: But certain ones, from the synagogue of the so-called Libertines, and of the Cyrenians, and of the Alexandrians, and of those who were from Cilicia and Asia rose up and were disputing with Stephen.
verses.textLa: Surrexerunt autem quidam de synagoga, quæ appellatur Libertinorum, et Cyrenensium, et Alexandrinorum, et eorum qui erant a Cilicia, et Asia, disputantes cum Stephano:

verses.textEn: But they were not able to resist the wisdom and the Spirit with which he was speaking.
verses.textLa: et non poterant resistere sapientiæ, et Spiritui, qui loquebatur.

verses.textEn: Then they suborned men who were to claim that they had heard him speaking words of blasphemy against Moses and against God.
verses.textLa: Tunc summiserunt viros, qui dicerent se audivisse eum dicentem verba blasphemiæ in Moysen, et in Deum.

verses.textEn: And thus did they stir up the people and the elders and the scribes. And hurrying together, they seized him and brought him to the council.
verses.textLa: Commoverunt itaque plebem, et seniores, et scribas: et concurrentes rapuerunt eum, et adduxerunt in concilium,

verses.textEn: And they set up false witnesses, who said: “This man does not cease to speak words against the holy place and the law.
verses.textLa: et statuerunt falsos testes, qui dicerent: Homo iste non cessat loqui verba adversus locum sanctum, et legem.

verses.textEn: For we have heard him saying that this Jesus the Nazarene will destroy this place and will change the traditions, which Moses handed down to us.”
verses.textLa: Audivimus enim eum dicentem: quoniam Iesus Nazarenus hic, destruet locum istum, et mutabit traditiones, quas tradidit nobis Moyses.

verses.textEn: And all those who were sitting in the council, gazing at him, saw his face, as if it had become the face of an Angel.
verses.textLa: Et intuentes eum omnes, qui sedebant in concilio, viderunt faciem eius tamquam faciem Angeli.

verses.textEn: Then the high priest said, “Are these things so?”
verses.textLa: Dixit autem princeps sacerdotum: Si hæc ita se habent?

verses.textEn: And Stephen said: “Noble brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he stayed in Haran.
verses.textLa: Qui ait: Viri fratres, et patres audite: Deus gloriæ apparuit patri nostro Abrahæ cum esset in Mesopotamia, prius quam moraretur in Charan.

verses.textEn: And God said to him, ‘Depart from your country and from your kindred, and go into the land that I will show to you.’
verses.textLa: Et dixit ad illum: Exi de terra tua, et de cognatione tua, et veni in terram, quam monstravero tibi.

verses.textEn: Then he went away from the land of the Chaldeans, and he lived at Haran. And later, after his father was dead, God brought him into this land, in which you now dwell.
verses.textLa: Tunc exiit de terra Chaldæorum, et habitavit in Charan. Et inde, postquam mortuus est pater eius, transtulit illum in terram istam, in qua nunc vos habitatis.

verses.textEn: And he gave him no inheritance in it, not even the space of one step. But he promised to give it to him as a possession, and to his offspring after him, though he did not have a son.
verses.textLa: Et non dedit illi hereditatem in ea, nec passum pedis: sed repromisit dare illi eam in possessionem, et semini eius post ipsum, cum non haberet filium.

verses.textEn: Then God told him that his offspring would be a settler in a foreign land, and that they would subjugate them, and treat them badly, for four hundred years.
verses.textLa: Locutus est autem ei Deus: Quia erit semen eius accola in terra aliena, et servituti eos subiicient, et male tractabunt eos annis quadringentis:

verses.textEn: ‘And the nation whom they will serve, I will judge,’ said the Lord. ‘And after these things, they shall depart and shall serve me in this place.’
verses.textLa: et gentem cui servierint, iudicabo ego, dixit Dominus. Et post hæc exibunt, et servient mihi in loco isto.

verses.textEn: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision. And so he conceived Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day. And Isaac conceived Jacob, and Jacob, the twelve Patriarchs.
verses.textLa: Et dedit illi testamentum circumcisionis: et sic genuit Isaac, et circumcidit eum die octavo: et Isaac, Iacob: et Iacob, duodecim Patriarchas.

verses.textEn: And the Patriarchs, being jealous, sold Joseph into Egypt. But God was with him.
verses.textLa: Et Patriarchæ æmulantes, Ioseph vendiderunt in Ægyptum. Et erat Deus cum eo:

verses.textEn: And he rescued him from all his tribulations. And he gave him grace and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. And he appointed him as governor over Egypt and over all his house.
verses.textLa: et eripuit eum ex omnibus tribulationibus eius: et dedit ei gratiam, et sapientiam in conspectu Pharaonis regis Ægypti, et constituit eum præpositum super Ægyptum, et super omnem domum suam.

verses.textEn: Then a famine occurred in all of Egypt and Canaan, and a great tribulation. And our fathers did not find food.
verses.textLa: Venit autem fames in universam Ægyptum, et Chanaan, et tribulatio magna: et non inveniebant cibos patres nostri.
verses.notes: Famines are associated with both the first and second parts of the tribulation.

verses.textEn: But when Jacob had heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our fathers first.
verses.textLa: Cum audisset autem Iacob esse frumentum in Ægypto: misit patres nostros primum:

verses.textEn: And on the second occasion, Joseph was recognized by his brothers, and his ancestry was made manifest to Pharaoh.
verses.textLa: et in secundo cognitus est Ioseph a fratribus suis, et manifestatum est Pharaoni genus eius.

verses.textEn: Then Joseph sent for and brought his father Jacob, with all his kindred, seventy-five souls.
verses.textLa: Mittens autem Ioseph accersivit Iacob patrem suum, et omnem cognationem suam in animabus septuagintaquinque.

verses.textEn: And Jacob descended into Egypt, and he passed away, and so did our fathers.
verses.textLa: Et descendit Iacob in Ægyptum, et defunctus est ipse, et patres nostri.

verses.textEn: And they crossed over into Shechem, and they were placed in the sepulcher which Abraham bought for a sum of money from the sons of Hamor, the son of Shechem.
verses.textLa: Et translati sunt in Sichem, et positi sunt in sepulchro, quod emit Abraham pretio argenti a filiis Hemor filii Sichem.

verses.textEn: And when the time of the Promise that God had revealed to Abraham drew near, the people increased and were multiplied in Egypt,
verses.textLa: Cum autem appropinquaret tempus promissionis, quam confessus erat Deus Abrahæ, crevit populus, et multiplicatus est in Ægypto,

verses.textEn: even until another king, who did not know Joseph, rose up in Egypt.
verses.textLa: quoadusque surrexit alius rex in Ægypto, qui non sciebat Ioseph.

verses.textEn: This one, encompassing our kindred, afflicted our fathers, so that they would expose their infants, lest they be kept alive.
verses.textLa: Hic circumveniens genus nostrum, afflixit patres nostros ut exponerent infantes suos ne vivificarentur.

verses.textEn: In the same time, Moses was born. And he was in the grace of God, and he was nourished for three months in the house of his father.
verses.textLa: Eodem tempore natus est Moyses et fuit gratus Deo, qui nutritus est tribus mensibus in domo patris sui.

verses.textEn: Then, having been abandoned, the daughter of Pharaoh took him in, and she raised him as her own son.
verses.textLa: Exposito autem illo, sustulit eum filia Pharaonis, et nutrivit eum sibi in filium.

verses.textEn: And Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians. And he was mighty in his words and in his deeds.
verses.textLa: Et eruditus est Moyses omni sapientia Ægyptiorum, et erat potens in verbis, et in operibus suis.

verses.textEn: But when forty years of age were completed in him, it rose up in his heart that he should visit his brothers, the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Cum autem impleretur ei quadraginta annorum tempus, ascendit in cor eius ut visitaret fratres suos filios Israel.

verses.textEn: And when he had seen a certain one suffering injury, he defended him. And striking the Egyptian, he wrought a retribution for him who was enduring the injury.
verses.textLa: Et cum vidisset quendam iniuriam patientem, vindicavit illum: et fecit ultionem ei, qui iniuriam sustinebat, percusso Ægyptio.

verses.textEn: Now he supposed that his brothers would understand that God would grant them salvation through his hand. But they did not understand it.
verses.textLa: Existimabat autem intelligere fratres, quoniam Deus per manum ipsius daret salutem illis: at illi non intellexerunt.

verses.textEn: So truly, on the following day, he appeared before those who were arguing, and he would have reconciled them in peace, saying, ‘Men, you are brothers. So why would you harm one another?’
verses.textLa: Sequenti vero die apparuit illis litigantibus: et reconciliabat eos in pace, dicens: Viri, fratres estis, ut quid nocetis alterutrum?

verses.textEn: But he who was causing the injury to his neighbor rejected him, saying: ‘Who has appointed you as leader and judge over us?
verses.textLa: Qui autem iniuriam faciebat proximo, repulit eum, dicens: Quis te constituit principem, et iudicem super nos?

verses.textEn: Could it be that you want to kill me, in the same way that you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’
verses.textLa: Numquid interficere me tu vis, quemadmodum interfecisti heri Ægyptium?

verses.textEn: Then, at this word, Moses fled. And he became a foreigner in the land of Midian, where he produced two sons.
verses.textLa: Fugit autem Moyses in verbo isto: et factus est advena in terra Madian, ubi generavit filios duos.

verses.textEn: And when forty years were completed, there appeared to him, in the desert of Mount Sinai, an Angel, in a flame of fire in a bush.
verses.textLa: Et expletis annis quadraginta, apparuit illi in deserto montis Sina Angelus in igne flammæ rubi.
verses.notes: Good Angels often have a role in miraculous signs and wonders, therefore, the assertion that a true miracle is something that is done by God alone is not correct. God often chooses to give true miracles through both the use of His power and through the use of His holy Angels.

verses.textEn: And upon seeing this, Moses was amazed at the sight. And as he drew near in order to gaze at it, the voice of the Lord came to him, saying:
verses.textLa: Moyses autem videns, admiratus est visum. Et accedente illo ut consideraret, facta est ad eum vox Domini, dicens:

verses.textEn: ‘I am the God of your fathers: the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’ And Moses, being made to tremble, did not dare to look.
verses.textLa: Ego sum Deus patrum tuorum, Deus Abraham, Deus Isaac, et Deus Iacob. Tremefactus autem Moyses, non audebat considerare.

verses.textEn: But the Lord said to him: ‘Loosen the shoes from your feet. For the place in which you stand is holy ground.
verses.textLa: Dixit autem illi Dominus: Solve calceamentum pedum tuorum: locus enim in quo stas, terra sancta est.

verses.textEn: Certainly, I have seen the affliction of my people who are in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning. And so, I am coming down to free them. And now, go forth and I will send you into Egypt.’
verses.textLa: Videns vidi afflictionem populi mei, qui est in Ægypto, et gemitum eorum audivi, et descendi liberare eos. Et nunc veni, et mittam te in Ægyptum.
verses.notes: The repetition of the verb intensified the meaning; it is not necessary to repeat the verb in the translation, but rather this intensification can be expressed in other ways.

verses.textEn: This Moses, whom they rejected by saying, ‘Who has appointed you as leader and judge?’ is the one God sent to be leader and redeemer, by the hand of the Angel who appeared to him in the bush.
verses.textLa: Hunc Moysen, quem negaverunt, dicentes: Quis te constituit principem et iudicem? Hunc Deus principem et redemptorem misit, cum manu Angeli, qui apparuit illi in rubo.

verses.textEn: This man led them out, accomplishing signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, and at the Red Sea, and in the desert, for forty years.
verses.textLa: Hic eduxit illos faciens prodigia, et signa in terra Ægypti, et in rubro mari, et in deserto annis quadraginta.

verses.textEn: This is Moses, who said to the sons of Israel: ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your own brothers. You shall listen to him.’
verses.textLa: Hic est Moyses, qui dixit filiis Israel: Prophetam suscitabit vobis Deus de fratribus vestris, tamquam me, ipsum audietis.

verses.textEn: This is he who was in the Church in the wilderness, with the Angel who was speaking to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers. It is he who received the words of life to give to us.
verses.textLa: Hic est, qui fuit in Ecclesia in solitudine cum Angelo, qui loquebatur ei in monte Sina, et cum patribus nostris: qui accepit verba vitæ dare nobis.
verses.notes: The assembly of the Israelites in the desert was a foreshadowing of the Catholic Christian Church, and was itself a kind of Church.

verses.textEn: It is he whom our fathers were not willing to obey. Instead, they rejected him, and in their hearts they turned away toward Egypt,
verses.textLa: Cui noluerunt obedire patres nostri: sed repulerunt, et aversi sunt cordibus suis in Ægyptum,

verses.textEn: saying to Aaron: ‘Make gods for us, which may go before us. For this Moses, who led us away from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him.’
verses.textLa: dicentes ad Aaron: Fac nobis deos, qui præcedant nos: Moyses enim hic, qui eduxit nos de terra Ægypti, nescimus quid factum sit ei.

verses.textEn: And so they fashioned a calf in those days, and they offered sacrifices to an idol, and they rejoiced in the works of their own hands.
verses.textLa: Et vitulum fecerunt in diebus illis, et obtulerunt hostiam simulachro, et lætabantur in operibus manuum suarum.

verses.textEn: Then God turned, and he handed them over, to subservience to the armies of heaven, just as it was written in the Book of the Prophets: ‘Did you not offer victims and sacrifices to me for forty years in the desert, O house of Israel?
verses.textLa: Convertit autem Deus, et tradidit eos servire militiæ cæli, sicut scriptum est in Libro Prophetarum: Numquid victimas, et hostias obtulistis mihi annis quadraginta in deserto, domus Israel?

verses.textEn: And yet you took up for yourselves the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of your god Rephan, figures which you yourselves formed in order to adore them. And so I will carry you away, beyond Babylon.’
verses.textLa: Et suscepistis tabernaculum Moloch, et sidus dei vestri Rempham, figuras, quas fecistis, adorare eas. Et transferam vos trans Babylonem.

verses.textEn: The tabernacle of the testimony was with our fathers in the desert, just as God ordained for them, speaking to Moses, so that he would make it according to the form that he had seen.
verses.textLa: Tabernaculum testimonii fui cum patribus nostris in deserto, sicut disposuit illis Deus, loquens ad Moysen, ut faceret illud secundum formam, quam viderat.

verses.textEn: But our fathers, receiving it, also brought it, with Joshua, into the land of the Gentiles, whom God expelled before the face of our fathers, even until the days of David,
verses.textLa: Quod et induxerunt, suscipientes patres nostri cum Iesu in possessionem Gentium, quas expulit Deus a facie patrum nostrorum, usque in diebus David,

verses.textEn: who found grace before God and who asked that he might obtain a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
verses.textLa: qui invenit gratiam ante Deum, et petiit ut inveniret tabernaculum Deo Iacob.

verses.textEn: But it was Solomon who built a house for him.
verses.textLa: Salomon autem ædificavit illi domum.

verses.textEn: Yet the Most High does not live in houses built by hands, just as he said through the prophet:
verses.textLa: Sed non Excelsus in manufactis habitat, sicut Propheta dicit:

verses.textEn: ‘Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house would you build for me? says the Lord. And which is my resting place?
verses.textLa: Cælum mihi sedes est: terra autem scabellum pedum meorum. Quam domum ædificabitis mihi, dicit Dominus? Aut quis locus requietionis meæ est?

verses.textEn: Has not my hand made all these things?’
verses.textLa: Nonne manus mea fecit hæc omnia?

verses.textEn: Stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, you ever resist the Holy Spirit. Just as your fathers did, so also do you do.
verses.textLa: Dura cervice, et incircumcisis cordibus, et auribus, vos semper Spiritui Sancto resistitis, sicut Patres vestri, ita et vos.

verses.textEn: Which of the Prophets have your fathers not persecuted? And they killed those who foretold the advent of the Just One. And you have now become the betrayers and murderers of him.
verses.textLa: Quem Prophetarum non sunt persecuti patres vestri? Et occiderunt eos, qui prænunciabant de adventu Iusti, cuius vos nunc proditores, et homicidæ fuistis:

verses.textEn: You received the law by the actions of Angels, and yet you have not kept it.”
verses.textLa: qui accepistis legem in dispositione Angelorum, et non custodistis.

verses.textEn: Then, upon hearing these things, they were deeply wounded in their hearts, and they gnashed their teeth at him.
verses.textLa: Audientes autem hæc dissecabantur cordibus suis, et stridebant dentibus in eum.

verses.textEn: But he, being filled with the Holy Spirit, and gazing intently toward heaven, saw the glory of God and Jesus standing at the right hand of God. And he said, “Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing at the right hand of God.”
verses.textLa: Cum autem esset plenus Spiritu Sancto, intendens in cælum, vidit gloriam Dei, et Iesum stantem a dextris Dei. Et ait: Ecce video cælos apertos, et Filium hominis stantem a dextris Dei.

verses.textEn: Then they, crying out with a loud voice, blocked their ears and, with one accord, rushed violently toward him.
verses.textLa: Exclamantes autem voce magna continuerunt aures suas, et impetum fecerunt unanimiter in eum.

verses.textEn: And driving him out, beyond the city, they stoned him. And witnesses placed their garments beside the feet of a youth, who was called Saul.
verses.textLa: Et eiicientes eum extra civitatem lapidabant: et testes deposuerunt vestimenta sua secus pedes adolescentis, qui vocabatur Saulus.

verses.textEn: And as they were stoning Stephen, he called out and said, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”
verses.textLa: Et lapidabant Stephanum invocantem, et dicentem: Domine Iesu suscipe spiritum meum.

verses.textEn: Then, having been brought to his knees, he cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” And when he had said this, he fell asleep in the Lord. And Saul was consenting to his murder.
verses.textLa: Positis autem genibus, clamavit voce magna, dicens: Domine ne statuas illis hoc peccatum. Et cum hoc dixisset, obdormivit in Domino. Saulus autem erat consentiens neci eius.

verses.textEn: Now in those days, there occurred a great persecution against the Church at Jerusalem. And they were all dispersed throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the Apostles.
verses.textLa: Facta est autem in illa die persecutio magna in Ecclesia, quæ erat Ierosolymis, et omnes dispersi sunt per regiones Iudææ, et Samariæ præter Apostolos.

verses.textEn: But God-fearing men arranged for Stephen’s funeral, and they made a great mourning over him.
verses.textLa: Curaverunt autem Stephanum viri timorati, et fecerunt planctum magnum super eum.

verses.textEn: Then Saul was laying waste to the Church by entering throughout the houses, and dragging away men and women, and committing them to prison.
verses.textLa: Saulus autem devastabat Ecclesiam per domos intrans, et trahens viros, ac mulieres, tradebat in custodiam.

verses.textEn: Therefore, those who had been dispersed were traveling around, evangelizing the Word of God.
verses.textLa: Igitur qui dispersi erant pertransibant, evangelizantes verbum Dei.

verses.textEn: Now Philip, descending to a city of Samaria, was preaching Christ to them.
verses.textLa: Philippus autem descendens in civitatem Samariæ, prædicabant illis Christum.

verses.textEn: And the crowd was listening intently and with one accord to those things which were being said by Philip, and they were watching the signs which he was accomplishing.
verses.textLa: Intendebant autem turbæ his, quæ a Philippo dicebantur unanimiter audientes, et videntes signa quæ faciebat.

verses.textEn: For many of them had unclean spirits, and, crying out with a loud voice, these departed from them.
verses.textLa: Multi enim eorum, qui habebant spiritus immundos, clamantes voce magna exibant.

verses.textEn: And many of the paralytics and the lame were cured.
verses.textLa: Multi autem paralytici, et claudi curati sunt.

verses.textEn: Therefore, there was great gladness in that city. Now there was a certain man named Simon, who formerly had been a magician in that city, seducing the people of Samaria, claiming himself to be someone great.
verses.textLa: Factum est ergo gaudium magnum in illa civitate. Vir autem quidam nomine Simon, qui ante fuerat in civitate magus, seducens gentem Samariæ, dicens se esse aliquem magnum:

verses.textEn: And to all those who would listen, from the least even to the greatest, he was saying: “Here is the power of God, which is called great.”
verses.textLa: cui auscultabant omnes a minimo usque ad maximum, dicentes: Hic est virtus Dei, quæ vocatur magna.

verses.textEn: And they were attentive to him because, for a long time, he had deluded them with his magic.
verses.textLa: Attendebant autem eum: propter quod multo tempore magiis suis dementasset eos.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, once they had believed Philip, who was evangelizing the kingdom of God, both men and women were baptized in the name of Jesus Christ.
verses.textLa: Cum vero credidissent Philippo evangelizanti de regno Dei, in nomine Iesu Christi baptizabantur viri, ac mulieres.

verses.textEn: Then Simon himself also believed and, when he had been baptized, he adhered to Philip. And now, seeing also the greatest signs and miracles being wrought, he was amazed and stupefied.
verses.textLa: Tunc Simon et ipse credidit: et cum baptizatus esset, adhærebat Philippo. Videns etiam signa, et virtutes maximas fieri, stupens admirabatur.

verses.textEn: Now when the Apostles who were in Jerusalem had heard that Samaria had received the Word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.
verses.textLa: Cum autem audissent Apostoli, qui erant Ierosolymis, quod recepisset Samaria verbum Dei, miserunt ad eos Petrum, et Ioannem:

verses.textEn: And when they had arrived, they prayed for them, so that they might receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.textLa: Qui cum venissent, oraverunt pro ipsis ut acciperent Spiritum Sanctum:

verses.textEn: For he had not yet come to any among them, since they were only baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.textLa: Nondum enim in quemquam illorum venerat, sed baptizati tantum erant in nomine Domini Iesu.
verses.notes: It seems from this passage that some early valid Baptisms used only the name of Jesus, and that receiving the Holy Spirit was a separate Sacrament, that of Confirmation. This is clear because the receiving of the Holy Spirit was through the laying on of hands, without the use of water.

verses.textEn: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
verses.textLa: Tunc imponebant manus super illos, et accipiebant Spiritum Sanctum.

verses.textEn: But when Simon had seen that, by the imposition of the hands of the Apostles, the Holy Spirit was given, he offered them money,
verses.textLa: Cum vidisset autem Simon quia per impositionem manus Apostolorum daretur Spiritus Sanctus, obtulit eis pecuniam,

verses.textEn: saying, “Give this power to me also, so that on whomever I will lay my hands, he may receive the Holy Spirit.” But Peter said to him:
verses.textLa: dicens: Date et mihi hanc potestatem, ut cuicumque imposuero manus, accipiat Spiritum Sanctum. Petrus autem dixit ad eum:

verses.textEn: “Let your money be with you in perdition, for you have supposed that a gift of God might be possessed by money.
verses.textLa: Pecunia tua tecum sit in perditionem: quoniam donum Dei existimasti pecunia possideri.

verses.textEn: There is no part or place for you in this matter. For your heart is not upright in the sight of God.
verses.textLa: Non est tibi pars, neque sors in sermone isto. Cor enim tuum non est rectum coram Deo.

verses.textEn: And so, repent from this, your wickedness, and beg God, so that perhaps this plan of your heart might be forgiven you.
verses.textLa: Pœnitentiam itaque age ab hac nequitia tua: et roga Deum, si forte remittatur tibi hæc cogitatio cordis tui.

verses.textEn: For I perceive you to be in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity.”
verses.textLa: In felle enim amaritudinis, et obligatione iniquitatis video te esse.

verses.textEn: Then Simon responded by saying, “Pray for me to the Lord, so that nothing of what you have said may happen to me.”
verses.textLa: Respondens autem Simon, dixit: Precamini vos pro me ad Dominum, ut nihil veniat super me horum, quæ dixistis.

verses.textEn: And indeed, after testifying and speaking the Word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, and they evangelized the many regions of the Samaritans.
verses.textLa: Et illi quidem testificati, et locuti verbum Domini, redibant Ierosolymam, et multis regionibus Samaritanorum evangelizabant.

verses.textEn: Now an Angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying, “Rise up and go toward the south, to the way which descends from Jerusalem into Gaza, where there is a desert.”
